message: It's not your fault by creating code like this, it's ReSharper's fault for not recognizing this code being "safe". So in this case you are smarter than the analyzer and as with the "!"-(null-forgiving)-operator you can explicitly say "I know better - this code is safe" by suppressing the warning. So suppressing the warning here seems to be the right thing to do. I don't want to obfuscate code only to satisfy the analyzer.
